Description: Body sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery stemmed bowl; interior unslipped; exterior, white slip: black-figure decoration (much worn) in two friezes separated by two bands; above two lions to right (front of first, with ham frill collar and traces of added red; hindquarter and leg of second; incised blob rosette as filling ornament); below, part of head with curlicue and wing of sphinx to right.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in Stage 1 of Group D of the Sphinx and Lion Style. Although the imagery is lively, the execution of the figures is loose and careless.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 148, p. 310, no. 1291)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2070) (phase 2)
